alert.note: Alert for Grayson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Slow moving thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Grayson County through 445 PM EDT with torrential rainfall... At 413 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking slow moving thunderstorms over Bridle Creek, or near Mouth Of Wilson, moving east at 10 to 15 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall and wind gusts to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Torrential rain will produce ponding of water on roads and fill up roadside ditches and culverts. Locations impacted include... Independence... Mouth Of Wilson... Volney... and Bridle Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
